docs.lead_paragraph: The study of domestic workers recommended including them under state minimum wage protections and other safeguards.

headline.seo: A Study of Home Help Finds Low Worker Pay and Few Benefits
headline.main: A Study of Home Help Finds Low Worker Pay
headline.print_headline: A Study of Home Help Finds Low Worker Pay

docs.abstract: First-ever national study of domestic workers finds they earn a median wage of about $10 an hour, and few receive benefits like health insurance or paid sick days; recommends including them under state minimum wage protections and other safeguards.
docs.snippet: The study of domestic workers recommended including them under state minimum wage protections and other safeguards.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court also cleared the way for further challenges to aspects of the health care law and rejected an appeal concerning the insanity defense.

headline.seo: Supreme Court Hears Job Discrimination Case
headline.main: Justices Consider Definition of Supervisor in Job Discrimination Case
headline.print_headline: Justices Consider Qualifications Needed to Be a Supervisor in a Discrimination Suit

docs.abstract: Supreme Court hears arguments in employment discrimination case, clears way for further challenges to aspects of Pres Obama's  health care law and rejects an appeal concerning the insanity defense.

docs.lead_paragraph: Cardinal Timothy M. Dolan, New York’s conservative archbishop, has embraced the canonization cause of the Brooklyn-born social activist Dorothy Day.

headline.seo: Dolan Champions Sainthood for Dorothy Day, Hero of Catholic Left
headline.main: In Hero of the Catholic Left, a Conservative Cardinal Sees a Saint
headline.print_headline: In Hero of the Catholic Left, a Conservative Cardinal Sees a Saint

docs.abstract: Cardinal Timothy M Dolan, New York’s conservative archbishop, has breathed new life into effort to canonize Brooklyn-born social activist and Catholic leftist Dorothy Day; United States Conference of Catholic Bishops, at his urging, has voted to move forward with her canonization cause; he and other conservative Catholics have embraced Day as exemplary modern Catholic who was both committed to social justice and loyal to church teachings.
docs.snippet: Cardinal Timothy M. Dolan, New York’s conservative archbishop, has embraced the canonization cause of the Brooklyn-born social activist Dorothy Day.

keywords.value: United States Conference of Catholic Bishops
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: With nearly one in five Medicare patients returning to the hospital within a month, the government has begun fining hospitals it says have had too many readmissions.

headline.seo: Hospitals Face Pressure From Medicare to Avert Readmissions
headline.main: Hospitals Face Pressure to Avert Readmissions
headline.print_headline: Hospitals Face Pressure To Avert Readmissions

docs.abstract: Government has begun levying financial penalties against 2,217 hospitals that it says have had too many patient readmissions, with maximum punishment being 1 percent reduction in Medicare's regular payments for every patient cared for over next year; crackdown on readmissions is at the vanguard of the Affordable Care Act’s effort to eliminate unnecessary care and curb Medicare’s growing spending, which reached $556 billion this year.
docs.snippet: With nearly one in five Medicare patients returning to the hospital within a month, the government has begun fining hospitals it says have had too many readmissions.

headline.main: Debt Reckoning: Updates on the Fiscal Deadline

docs.abstract: This feature follows the talks between President Obama and Congressional leaders over the so-called fiscal cliff. It aims to explain the major economic and fiscal issues, examine public opinion and analyze the options that the parties are considering as the deadline approaches.

headline.main: Study Questions Tax Breaks' Effect on Retirement Savings
headline.print_headline: Tax Breaks and Savings Play Role in Budget Talks

docs.abstract: Every year, the government spends more than $100 billion on tax breaks to encourage Americans to save more for retirement. But a new study suggests such provisions may have little effect on the amount Americans save.
docs.snippet: Every year, the government spends more than $100 billion on tax breaks to encourage Americans to save more for retirement. But a new study suggests such provisions may have little effect on the amount Americans save.
